subsc: Micro- and SME finance,Roads and highways,Sewerage,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome of the project is
            rated as satisfactory. The following lessons can be drawn:
            1) It is crucial to rely on continuity and not sacrifice
            project supervision while prematurely preparing a parallel
            project. 2) Technical assistance needs to be carefully
            monitored and based on clear terms of reference and if well
            targeted can support local capacity and help develop a
            greater sense of responsibility and ownership from the
            central and local governments. 3) Effective and efficient
            solid waste collection can be provided in large cities like
            Conakry by small scale local private contractors using low
            cost technologies. 4) Financing of solid waste collection
            can be achieved through direct collection of user charges
            when services are regularly provided and households are
            willing to pay. 5) Up front and appropriate compensation and
            clearing of customary land tenure are fundamental to any
            urban land development program. 6) Bank and borrower
            commitments are paramount for project success.
